title: missing rows when converting TFIDFvectorizer with max_features specified
body:
When running the code below, when `max_features = 100` is used, then the runtime session seems to lose rows in the conversion (1998 rows are returned from a dataframe of 2000, so X_from_onnx.shape is (1998,100). 
This does not happen when max_features is not used. in that case, the shape is (2000,2380).


    vectorizer = TfidfVectorizer(max_features = 100)
    vectorizer.fit(df['my_text_column'])

    tfidf_onnx_pipe_file = "some_file"
    inputs = [  ( 'short_description',    StringTensorType(shape=[None, 1])  )]
    tfidf_onnx = skl2onnx.convert_sklearn(vectorizer, 'tfidf_vectorizer', inputs)

    with open(tfidf_onnx_pipe_file, "wb") as f:
        f.write(tfidf_onnx.SerializeToString())

    sess = rt.InferenceSession(tfidf_onnx_pipe_file)
    X_from_onnx = sess.run( None, {'short_description': df['my_text_column'].values.reshape(len(df),1)  })[0]
